The Global Compact in Bolivia  

The Global Compact Network in Bolivia was launched on November 14th, 2006 by the Bolivian Foundation of Corporate Social Responsibility (COBORSE).

During the first General Assembly of the Network on  November 13th, 2008 a Steering Committee was established and following participants were appointed: Banco de Crédito de Bolivia, Transierra, Gas TransBoliviano, Transportadora de Electricidad and Grupo Empresarial Kantutani.

Activities/Events

The objective of the Global Compact Local Network Bolivia and COBORSE is to develop and promote the practice of CSR in order to build a more sustainable and just society, based on responsible management, the adoption of the United Nations Global Compact principles, and the practice of responsible citizenship among companies that operate in Bolivia

Main activities:

  • Workshops on the importance of the GC and on how to elaborate a Communication on Progress (CoP)
  • Contribute to local learning by introducing the principles of the Global Compact during CSR workshops and seminars
  • Assist companies “one on one” in the preparation and posting of their COP.
